Photocatalytic C–F bond activation in small molecules and polyfluoroalkyl substances

  • Xin Liu

elements.title: Concerns regarding proposed groundwater Earth system boundary (Nature - research articles)

Concerns regarding proposed groundwater Earth system boundary

  • M. O. Cuthbert

  • R. G. Taylor
Matters ArisingOpen Access20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Coupling of unactivated alkyl electrophiles using frustrated ion pairs (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Coupling of unactivated alkyl electrophiles using frustrated ion pairs

A transition-metal-free platform enables the formation of challenging C(sp3)–C(sp3) bonds in organic compounds via single-electron transfer, facilitating the coupling of functionalized fragments and expanding possibilities for efficient organic synthesis and reaction design.

  • Sven Roediger
  • Emilien Le Saux
  • Bill Morandi
ArticleOpen Access20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Photocatalytic low-temperature defluorination of PFASs (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Photocatalytic low-temperature defluorination of PFASs

Photocatalysis at 40–60 °C is shown to be able to defluorinate perfluoroalkyl substances, known as ‘forever chemicals’, allowing the recycling of fluorine in polyfluoroalkyl and perfluoroalkyl substances as inorganic fluoride salt.

  • Hao Zhang
  • Jin-Xiang Chen
  • Yan-Biao Kang
Article20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Reply to: Concerns regarding proposed groundwater Earth system boundary (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Reply to: Concerns regarding proposed groundwater Earth system boundary

  • S. E. Bunn
  • B. Stewart-Koster
  • S. J. Lade
Matters ArisingOpen Access20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Broadly inhibitory antibodies to severe malaria virulence proteins (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Broadly inhibitory antibodies to severe malaria virulence proteins

Two broadly reactive and inhibitory human monoclonal antibodies against the malaria parasite Plasmodium falciparum have been characterized, providing insights into immunity, prevention and treatment of severe malaria.

  • Raphael A. Reyes
  • Sai Sundar Rajan Raghavan
  • Thomas Lavstsen
Article20 Nov 2024

elements.title: A spatial human thymus cell atlas mapped to a continuous tissue axis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A spatial human thymus cell atlas mapped to a continuous tissue axis

A quantitative morphological framework for the human thymus reveals the establishment of the lobular cytokine network, canonical thymocyte trajectories and thymic epithelial cell distributions in fetal and paediatric thymic development.

  • Nadav Yayon
  • Veronika R. Kedlian
  • Sarah A. Teichmann
ArticleOpen Access20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Efficient green InP-based QD-LED by controlling electron injection and leakage (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Efficient green InP-based QD-LED by controlling electron injection and leakage

Replacing ZnSeS with a thickened ZnSe layer in green InP-based QD-LEDs improves the efficiency and lifetime, boosting electron injection and reducing leakage, enabling 26.68% external quantum efficiency and 1,241 h T95 lifetime.

  • Yangyang Bian
  • Xiaohan Yan
  • Huaibin Shen
Article20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Exaptation of ancestral cell-identity networks enables C4 photosynthesis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Exaptation of ancestral cell-identity networks enables C4 photosynthesis

Single-nucleus RNA-sequencing and chromatin-accessibility analyses in rice (a C3 plant) and sorghum (a C4 plant) provide insight into how C4 photosynthesis evolved in bundle-sheath cells, revealing that the acquisition of ancestral cis-elements was key.

  • Joseph Swift
  • Leonie H. Luginbuehl
  • Julian M. Hibberd
ArticleOpen Access20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Fibular reduction and the evolution of theropod locomotion (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Fibular reduction and the evolution of theropod locomotion

Using three-dimensional kinematic analyses, fibular reduction is shown to have a functional evolutionary adaptative role in birds to enable knee long-axis rotation.

  • Armita R. Manafzadeh
  • Stephen M. Gatesy
  • Bhart-Anjan S. Bhullar
Article20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Normal breast tissues harbour rare populations of aneuploid epithelial cells (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Normal breast tissues harbour rare populations of aneuploid epithelial cells

Using single-cell DNA sequencing we show that most healthy women harbour rare populations of aneuploid epithelial cells with copy number alteration events in their breast tissue that expand and accumulate with age.

  • Yiyun Lin
  • Junke Wang
  • Nicholas Navin
Article20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Early-twentieth-century cold bias in ocean surface temperature observations (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Early-twentieth-century cold bias in ocean surface temperature observations

Independent statistical reconstructions of the global mean surface temperature from either ocean or land data show that existing estimates of early-twentieth-century ocean surface temperatures are too cold.

  • Sebastian Sippel
  • Elizabeth C. Kent
  • Reto Knutti
ArticleOpen Access20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Spatially restricted immune and microbiota-driven adaptation of the gut (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Spatially restricted immune and microbiota-driven adaptation of the gut

Intestinal regionalization is characterized by robust and resilient structural cell states and the intestine can adapt to environmental stress in a spatially controlled manner through crosstalk between immunity and structural cell homeostasis.

  • Toufic Mayassi
  • Chenhao Li
  • Ramnik J. Xavier
Article20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Trion sensing of a zero-field composite Fermi liquid (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Trion sensing of a zero-field composite Fermi liquid

Using the unique valley properties of a twisted MoTe2 bilayer, measurements of the degree of circular polarization of trion photoluminescence reveal optical signatures of a zero-field composite Fermi liquid.

  • Eric Anderson
  • Jiaqi Cai
  • Xiaodong Xu
Article20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Liver X receptor unlinks intestinal regeneration and tumorigenesis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Liver X receptor unlinks intestinal regeneration and tumorigenesis

Liver X receptor drives epithelial Areg-mediated intestinal regeneration, while preventing tumour growth through adaptive immune responses.

  • Srustidhar Das
  • S. Martina Parigi
  • Eduardo J. Villablanca
ArticleOpen Access20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Learning high-accuracy error decoding for quantum processors (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Learning high-accuracy error decoding for quantum processors

A recurrent, transformer-based neural network, called AlphaQubit, learns high-accuracy error decoding to suppress the errors that occur in quantum systems, opening the prospect of using neural-network decoders for real quantum hardware.

  • Johannes Bausch
  • Andrew W. Senior
  • Pushmeet Kohli
ArticleOpen Access20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Single-molecule states link transcription factor binding to gene expression (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Single-molecule states link transcription factor binding to gene expression

A study uses single-molecule footprinting to measure protein occupancy at regulatory elements on individual molecules in human cells and describes how different properties of transcription factor binding contribute to gene expression.

  • Benjamin R. Doughty
  • Michaela M. Hinks
  • William J. Greenleaf
Article20 Nov 2024

elements.title: Cephalopod-inspired jetting devices for gastrointestinal drug delivery (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Cephalopod-inspired jetting devices for gastrointestinal drug delivery

Tethered or ingestible delivery systems that deliver liquid microjets in axial and radial directions can be used to deliver macromolecules to different parts of the gastrointestinal tract with good bioavailability.

  • G. Arrick
  • D. Sticker
  • G. Traverso
ArticleOpen Access20 Nov 2024

elements.contents:
Plotting Fluorescent Spectra
ggplot2
R
coding
fluoresence

elements.title: Interactively Visualising Proteins (Brady Johnston)
elements.contents:
Interactively Visualising Proteins
bioinformatics
R
protein
Recently I’ve been doing a lot of structural bioinformatics. To avoid having to export my results into PyMol of Chimerax, I wanted a better solution that could embed the results more easily into the report that I was writing.
Brady Johnston
Feb 15, 2021

elements.title: Visualising Global Rubbish (Brady Johnston)
elements.contents:
